node.title: Tourist killed by shark in popular snorkeling spot
node.description: The 56-year-old man was swimming near a cliff when he was bitten by the shark.

node.title: "Madness": U.N. chief warns Ukraine war could kill climate change fight
node.description: Antonio Guterres said the "all-of-the-above' strategy now being pursued by major economies to end fossil fuel imports from Russia could kill hopes of keeping global warming below dangerous levels.

node.title: Boater rescues man from lake, then kills him after altercation
node.description: The woman who was with Nathan Drew Morgan pushed him back into the lake in an attempt to defuse the situation, but he was later shot.

node.title: DNA leads to arrest of man two decades after rapes of women
node.description: Kenneth Downing was arrested at a construction site after police say his DNA matched evidence collected at multiple crime scenes.

node.title: "Historic event": Antarctica experiencing record-shattering warmth
node.description: One geoscientist says it's "a Pacific Northwest 2021 heat wave kind of event. Never supposed to happen."

node.title: Passenger jet carrying 133 people crashes in Chinese countryside
node.description: The China Eastern Airlines Boeing 737 came down in a rural area near the city of Wuzhou, causing a "mountain fire" and unknown casualties.

node.title: 'Simply the best' - Shane Warne farewelled in private funeral
node.description: Family, sportspeople and entertainers bid farewell to Australian cricketing legend Shane Warne at a private funeral held at his hometown in Melbourne on Sunday.

node.title: Investigators for David Ortiz say jealous drug dealer had him shot
node.description: That drug dealer is being held on unrelated charges in Puerto Rico. His lawyer denies he had anything to do with the shooting. Prosecutors in the Dominican Republic, where Ortiz was shot, say it was a case of mistaken identity.

node.title: Staffing the key issue for tourism sector
node.description: Ashburton's tourism promoters are more focussed on business support than marketing, as confidence in the sector suffers from Covid-19 symptoms.

node.title: Strong volcanic tremors detected at Mt Ruapehu
node.description: The volcanic alert level has been raised to two.

node.title: Top of the south orchards seek to replenish workforce
node.description: A campaign to attract seasonal workers to the horticulture and viticulture industries in Nelson Tasman has recruited several hundred people, but many orchards in the top of the south are still looking…

node.title: Constant switches in care, but what progress has there been for Māori?
node.description: Analysis - That creaking sound you may have noticed at the Abuse in Care Royal Commission of Inquiry was indeed the familiar sound of a rather old pendulum swinging, David Cohen writes.

node.title: Covid-19 update: Nine deaths, 1000 in hospital and 14,463 community cases
node.description: The Ministry of Health says one of the nine Covid-related deaths include a person in their 20s.

node.title: Fourth body found, one still missing near North Cape
node.description: A fourth body has been found in a search and rescue operation off North Cape at the top of the North Island.

node.title: Appeal for witnesses after man shot by police on SH1 in Invercargill
node.description: Police are wanting to speak to anyone who was on SH1 in Invercargill on Saturday and saw an incident which ended with a man being shot by police.

node.title: Chocolate fish, t-shirts and a can of coke: Council leaders' card spend
node.description: Chocolate fish, free t-shirts and a book named Fifteen Shades of Climate were among more than $112,000 in credit card purchases by Bay of Plenty leaders last year.

node.title: Wanted man who went missing with children briefly returned home - police
node.description: Thomas Phillips reassured his family during the visit that he and his children were well.

node.title: Ukraine rejects Russian demand to surrender port city in exchange for safe passage
node.description: Ukraine angrily rejected the offer, which came hours after officials said Russian forces had bombed an art school that was sheltering some 400 people.

node.title: As it happened: Schools closed, houses flooded as wild weather battered North Island
node.description: Several Auckland schools have closed and some houses in Northland are flooded after a deluge of heavy rain and lightning hammered the regions.

node.title: Assault victim's critical injuries caused by blunt force trauma - police
node.description: Police have revealed more details of a "very serious" assault that took place in Upper Hutt on Saturday night.

node.title: Week in Politics: Big announcements mark the dawn of a new era
node.description: Analysis - Tourists will soon be back, the government cuts the price of petrol to ease the pain at the pump and National loses one of its most experienced MPs.

node.title: 'It brought everyone together': Moves to restore much loved pub
node.description: The Dux de Lux pub in Christchurch could be set to open its doors again if enough money can be raised to restore it. Audio

node.title: Why sharing your Netflix login could soon be a thing of the past
node.description: The days of freely sharing your Netflix password with your mates could be about to end, with the streaming giant looking to charge more for people who use an account "outside the household". Audio

node.title: Marines release names of 4 killed in crash in Norway during NATO drill
node.description: The annual NATO drills in Norway are unrelated to the war in Ukraine​.

node.title: Why are rents skyrocketing across the country?
node.description: Lesley Stahl reports on how lack of construction in the 2010s has created a nationwide housing crisis, and opportunistic Wall Street firms have stepped in.

node.title: The strategy behind the economic sanctions against Russia
node.description: The world has responded to Russia's invasion of Ukraine with crippling sanctions that are damaging the Russian economy.

node.title: Clarence Thomas hospitalized with infection
node.description: A court spokesperson told CBS News that Thomas does not have COVID-19.

node.title: Antarctica heatwave sends temperatures 40C above normal
node.description: There has been a freak heatwave in Antarctica, which holds 70 percent of Earth's fresh water. Audio

node.title: Three dead, two missing in search and rescue operation off North Cape
node.description: Three bodies have been found in a search and rescue operation off North Cape at the top of the North Island.

node.title: Motorists, truckers may pay higher vehicle running charges
node.description: Households are facing extra costs to run a vehicle, under a proposed revamp of road funding.
